briefdescription.para: Default maximum rotation speed in degrees per second.
Default minimum rotation speed before rotation stops completely.
Default exponential decay factor for rotation when input stops.
Maximum rotation speed in degrees per second.
Minimum rotation speed before rotation stops completely.
Exponential decay factor for rotation when input stops.
Current rotation angle in degrees.
Target rotation angle derived from input direction.
Shortest angular distance to target rotation.
Current rotation speed after applying input and dampening.
Indicates whether input is currently being received.
Intensity of the turn input, typically from 0.0 to 1.0.

detaileddescription.para: Derived from the magnitude of the input direction vector. Used to modulate rotation speed based on stick deflection.

briefdescription.para: Current steering input as 2D direction vector.
The axis around which rotation occurs.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to Z-axis for 2D top-down rotation.

briefdescription.para: Flag for instant rotation mode.

detaileddescription.para: When true, the entity snaps to the target rotation instantly rather than smoothly interpolating.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Constructs a SteeringComponent with specified instant rotation mode.

parameterdescription.para: If true, rotation snaps instantly to target.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.
Returns whether instant rotation mode is enabled.

simplesect.para: True if rotation snaps instantly, false for smooth interpolation.

briefdescription.para: Sets the heading direction and turn intensity from input.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the heading input vector and turn intensity. If the turn intensity is below the epsilon threshold, input is deactivated and the heading is reset to zero.

parameterdescription.para: Normalized direction vector representing the desired heading.

simplesect.para: direction must be a normalized vector (length ~= 1.0).

briefdescription.para: Returns the axis around which rotation occurs.

detaileddescription.para: For 2D gameplay on the XY plane, this is typically the Z-axis.

simplesect.para: The rotation axis as a unit vector.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current rotation speed.
Returns the current rotation speed.
Returns the angular distance to the target rotation.
Returns the current rotation angle.

simplesect.para: The current rotation angle in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Returns the target rotation angle.

simplesect.para: The target rotation angle in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Sets the target rotation angle.

parameterdescription.para: The new target rotation angle in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current rotation angle.

parameterdescription.para: The new rotation angle in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Sets the angular distance to the target rotation.

parameterdescription.para: The new angle delta in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Checks if input is currently active.

simplesect.para: True if input is active, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current steering input direction.

simplesect.para: Const reference to the 2D steering input vector.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum rotation speed in degrees per second.
Returns the minimum rotation speed threshold.

simplesect.para: Rotation speed threshold below which rotation stops.

briefdescription.para: Returns the rotation dampening factor.
Sets the maximum rotation speed in degrees per second.
Sets the minimum rotation speed threshold.
Sets the rotation dampening factor.
Returns the current turn intensity.

simplesect.para: Turn intensity value, typically from 0.0 to 1.0.

briefdescription.para: Resets all physics parameters to their default values.
Component that manages the heading (orientation) of an entity.

detaileddescription.para: This component handles the rotational physics of an entity, including turning towards a target direction, rotation speed limits, and dampening. It maintains the current and target rotation angles and is used by the SteeringSystem to update the entity's orientation.
